item.title: Sleeping bags, bottle filled with inidentified liquid, food takeaway remains and other detritus left by a rough sleeper., 12th September
item.description:
The rough sleeper has been sleeping on the ground floors of flats 16-30 and 31-45 Hillcrest for at least 10 days. He has been sleeping directly in front of the locked doors that allow access to the electrical fuse switchboards for eack block of flats. Besides sleeping materials (which may be biologically hazardous to touch) litter has been left behind. It needs to be cleared and the areas disinfected by cleaning staff and professionals. The situation has been going on for at least two weeks. Sooner or later the problem of public health/human waste removal will arise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sunray Avenue, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Highway footpath blocked (obstructed) at 06:30hrs 12/09/25 and overnight every day at this location in Willow Grove. The rules on pavement parking are much clearer in London and in Scotland, both of which are specifically mentioned in the Highway Code "You MUST NOT park partially or wholly on the pavement in London or Scotland." "Parking on the pavement can obstruct and seriously inconvenience pedestrians, people in wheelchairs or with visual impairments and people with prams or pushchairs." RNIB says 92% of blind and partially sighted people have had to walk into the road to avoid collisions with obstacles, while 34% had collided with a street obstacle in the past three months., 12th September
item.description:
Highway footpath blocked (obstructed) at 06:30hrs 12/09/25 and overnight every day at this location in Willow Grove. The rules on pavement parking are much clearer in London and in Scotland, both of which are specifically mentioned in the Highway Code "You MUST NOT park partially or wholly on the pavement in London or Scotland." "Parking on the pavement can obstruct and seriously inconvenience pedestrians, people in wheelchairs or with visual impairments and people with prams or pushchairs." RNIB says 92% of blind and partially sighted people have had to walk into the road to avoid collisions with obstacles, while 34% had collided with a street obstacle in the past three months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Grove, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Car has been here 6 weeks now - hasn’t moved - think it’s been abandoned, 12th September
item.description:
This car has been parked outside my house on Lucerne Court for 6 weeks now and hasn’t moved in that time. I and my neighbours have made enquiries and cannot locate the owner. We do not recognise the car and this is therefore highly unusual. It’s also parked relatively close to my drive exit and makes reversing out awkward. There is no permanent parking on this road, so it should not be there. Am concerned it’s a stolen vehicle that has been abandoned here ready to collect later (on the Beckenham Facebook group this seems a common tactic for car thief’s). I left a note on the car at the beginning of this week giving fair warning that I was going to report this, so am left with no option at this point as it shouldn’t be there and we don’t recognise it nor know the owner. If you can help that would be great.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Lucerne Court, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Terrible parking, 12th September
item.description:
This car has been parked here for over two weeks now taking up two bays, hasn’t moved. We pay £500 a year to park here and he is taking up vital spaces. We are loosing spaces to bike & hire bays, spaces are limited, we need to be considerate to neighbors

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A very dangerous pothole about 70 cm wide. Distance from the edge of the kerb 1 meter and 20 cents not where you would normally expect one a bit to the inside covered my moving traffic., 12th September
item.description:
This pothole is very very dangerous because it's hidden by moving cars and located inside the road, As soon as pass the traffic lights I suppose to lean towards the right as I'm taking half moon lane towards Dulwich suddenly the lime hire bike dipped or bumped very hard on this pothole as a result I lost control and balance and off my seat nearly flipped over in the middle of the road while there's moving cars with tow lanes nearly killed . I hardly hit the ground with my too feet and thanks heavens I managed to stop the bike and that there was a safe distance between me and the cars behind me so I wasn't hit . I came out the road recovering from the shock and a gentle man walking by said well done you been very lucky and I said this pothole could kill some body and he agreed Please fill this pothole. Thank you Regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet
